With Frank Gladstone? I took it under the FEA number, but the name sounds very familiar.
The class was dreadfully boring. You're stuck looking at animation from the 20s and 30s for weeks before you get into anything remotely familiar. Almost all of the modern stuff is glossed over in the final class. The middle chunk of the class mostly revolves around stuff from the 40s-80s with a heavy emphasis on the earlier stuff from that period. Attendance is mandatory, he passes a sheet around during class.
I believe there are only three assignments. A midterm, extra credit essay, and a final essay. Each essay is 2 pages each. I got an F on the midterm, but he curves the grade, so including both essays I wound up with a B in the class.
If you're just taking the class as a requirement, I guess I'd recommend it, you could always just arrive sometime during the last hour and sign the attendance sheet at the end if you decide you're not up to sticking around for the full 3 hours.
I took it because I thought it'd be fun and interesting part of my major, and it really wasn't.
They probably already had these figures planned, they just wanted fans to feel like they had a say in it. I'm sure it was 100% rigged from the start.
